result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Land Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Restitution in the amount of $80.00 payable to Rena G. to be collected during term of extended supervision on case 16CF509; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.

*Court ordered defendant pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments during term of extended supervision on case 16CF509; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.
*Court waived DNA sample due to DNA sample assessed on case 16CF509.

*Straight time, with credit for 2 days time served.
*No contact with Rena G.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Land Sr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony Land in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Anthony Land in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.    

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  

The Court sentenced defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Corrections, straight time, with credit for 2 days time served.  

-Court ordered defendant pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments during term of extended supervision on case 16CF509; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-Court waived DNA sample due to DNA sample assessed on case 16CF509
-Restitution in the amount of $80.00 payable to Rena G. to be collected during term of extended supervision on case 16CF509; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No contact with Rena G. 

Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Pretrial Incarceration Credit Sheet

Attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales in court, defendant Anthony Land not in court, in custody and not produced.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defense counsel has received discovery and offer. Defendant has a pending felony in Branch 19, Honorable Judge Cimp's court. For reasons stated on the record, Court authorizes transfer to Branch 19. Per Deputy Court Clerk approved transfer.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 19,  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales in court, defendant Anthony Land not in court, in custody.  
Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Scheduling.  Defendant not produced for todays brief hearing.  Hearing proceeded.  Defendant has pending felony matter.  
Parties engaged in negotiations; pretrial date selected before Branch 31.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.   Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Rena G.; Anthony R.

Defendant Anthony Land in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Anthony Land in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rifelj, Branch 31.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Discharge Report received and filed.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) gj
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Gabriela A Leija in court prior to case being called.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for calendar call. Court ordered stayed warrant lifted.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered  Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Gabriela A Leija in court.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until a Calendar Call in Branch 23.  Calendar call scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Rena G; Anthony R.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Anthony Land in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Anthony Land in custody.  
Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  

DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
